intro: Tetramolopium gracile, commonly known as slender tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, and the leaves are narrow and hairy. Tetramolopium gracile is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of local ecosystems.
